summary: The Department of Defense received about $10.5 billion to help it respond to COVID-19 . We examined DOD's strategy for protecting servicemembers as well as its research and development work on vaccines, testing, and more. DOD's strategy seeks to balance a reduction of health risk with the need to continue operations. Among other things, it identifies mission-essential functions, prioritizes vaccine distribution, and calls for protective...
title: COVID-19: DOD Has Focused on Strategy and Oversight to Protect Military Servicemember Health
